head.title: Mother Is Investigated In Death of Son, 13

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

hedline.hl1: Mother Is Investigated In Death of Son, 13

abstract.p: Daniel Tobin, 13, of Washington Township, NJ, dies of drug overdose and police investigate whether his mother, Mary Alice Tobin, provided him with illegal drugs; she has been arrested on charges of distributing cocaine and marijuana to four youths who knew her son; under state law, whoever supplies lethal dose of illegal drugs can be held responsible for death (S)

block.p: The Gloucester County Prosecutors' Office is investigating whether the mother of a 13-year-old boy found dead in his bed on Tuesday caused the boy's death by providing him with illegal drugs.

Prosecutors are handling the death of the boy, Daniel Tobin, as a potential drug overdose after discovering a hypodermic needle in his bedroom, Andrew N. Yurick, the Gloucester County Prosecutor, said.

Prosecutors are handling the death of the boy, Daniel Tobin, as a potential drug overdose after discovering a hypodermic needle in his bedroom, Andrew N. Yurick, the Gloucester County Prosecutor, said.

Daniel's mother, Mary Alice Tobin, was arrested Wednesday on charges that she distributed cocaine and marijuana to four Washington Township youths who were acquainted with Daniel. Investigators are trying to determine whether Ms. Tobin, 40, also provided her son with drugs, he said. Under state law, whoever supplies a lethal dose of illegal drugs can be held responsible for the death.
